algorithm_technique: In-place reversal and inversion of rows using two pointers.
problem_summary_simple: Flip each row horizontally, then invert all bits (0 to 1, 1 to 0).
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through rows, use two pointers to swap and invert elements simultaneously for horizontal flip.
key_insights: The horizontal flip and inversion can be combined efficiently.
Using two pointers (start and end of the row) allows in-place modification.
The `~i` operator is a concise way to get the index from the end of the list.
